still have enough of a reason to be in these RP zones.\n

gaining power that things can be done there as well, from an admin\n
standpoint.\n

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Ubermap
\n`7CC`6: `7Varulv Beonca Boris Ranulf Eliana
\n\n
I spent some time working on zone estimates for the continental\n
map, and came up with two options for zone size.\n
\n
Option 1:\n
Tar Valon is 25 rooms north, 9 rooms east of Caemlyn.  This\n
gives a movement rate of 5 rooms per day for troop mobs.  By\n
comparison, Aringill is 10 rooms east and 1 room south of Caemlyn.\n
This makes the continental map 13 zones wide and 11 zones high,\n
or 143 areas (14300 descriptions).  In other words, you can\n
walk north across the entire continent in 105 rooms, and east\n
for 130 rooms.\n
\n
Option 2:\n
Tar Valon is 38 rooms north, 14 rooms east of Caemlyn.  Troops\n
move 8 rooms per day (Aringill would be a trip of 17 rooms, in\n
this case).  The continent would be 20 zones wide by 16 zones\n
high, giving an area of 320 zones and 32000 descriptions.\n
\n
What do you guys think? Any smaller scale than option 1, and\n
troop mobs will only be moving a couple rooms a day, which\n
gets lame for tactics and then there's just plain not enough\n
rooms from one end of the world to the other.  Any larger\n
scale than option 2, and we pass the point of getting old\n
and having the internet be outdated before we finish.\n
\n
I vote option 1.  It's most doable workwise and still gives\n
us tons of rooms to work with.  However, option 2 is perfectly\n
feasible, too, but it's the upper end of what we can do provided\n
lots of us work on it.\n
\n
-Nico\n

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Sudo and ubermap
\n`7CC`6: `7Boris Duren
\n\n
Re: Sudo - k. :p\n
\n
For the world files, I looked 'em over carefully and there's a\n
couple things.  Firstly (not your fault), the template file you\n
had was missing something, so I added it and resaved it as\n
200.wld.  When we do this for real, use 200.wld as your template.\n
\n
Secondly, your loop for file creation appears to be off in a\n
couple of minor ways.  For instance, row A needs to consist\n
of znums 200-225, not 200-224.  Row B is 230 - 255, not 231\n
to 244.  Every row is 26 rooms, and columns start at #00,\n
#30, and #60 for #'s 2 - 8.  The last row is just 900 - 925.\n
\n
Also, don't save 'em as .wld.bak files in the final version - they'll\n
have to be straight .wld files.  We'll also need the accompanying\n
index file (see  /../builderport/lib/world/wld/index) with all\n
the new zone numbers added.\n
\n
For the remaining file types (.obj, .mob and .zon), use the\n
template 240 (not 200).  240.obj, 240.mob and 240.zon will\n
work for all, and we need them numbered exactly the same\n
as the .wld files.  Also, each of those 3 file types has an\n
accompanying index file that's exactly the same as the\n
world index file except every reference of .wld is changed to\n
.obj, .mob or .zon, respectively.\n
\n
Otherwise, this is perfect.  Just need you to use the new\n
200.wld template and to get the loop working correctly, and\n
we're gold.  The text in the files is 100%.  Nice work :>\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Nov 13 12:55:32 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jake
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP
\n`7CC`6: `7Beonca Nenae Syrah
\n\n
The BP's back up with the ubermap fully imported.  It took a fair\n
bit of doing, because the number of rooms was bigger than circle\n
was coded for, so Duren and I had to go through and upgrade\n
everything - thank him, cuz no way I could have gotten it to work\n
by myself.  Incidently, Marek's a moron.  His code was some of\n
the most annoying, and it doesn't work right anyways.\n
\n
B, I'm real sorry, but I lost any changes you made to zone 3\n
between Wednesday when I imported it and Thursday when\n
I started upgrading the BP.  I was able to restore it to the version\n
that's on there now (same as the live version), but apparently\n
the daily backup system does not do anything for the BP.  I'm\n
sorry!\n
\n
We can do the next two stages of the project at the same time - I'm\n
going to continue to port over cities and zones as Syrah identifies\n
the keepers.  Currently, Caemlyn and Aringill are in, as well as\n
some essential zones that the BP won't run without, and that's it.\n
I'll be bringing over TV, Cairhien, and other major zones ASAP.\n
Syrah, any other zones you see that're keepers, recommendations\n
are helpful and would speed things up as you get time.\n
\n
At the same time I'm doing this, Syrah can be overseeing the\n
first real 'builder' phase of the project, where you guys link Caemlyn\n
and Aringill into their zones, and add in the descs of the surrounding\n
countrysides.  I sent Syrah a detailed writeup on how to do all of\n
this.  It includes vnums and specific instructions on exactly what\n
goes where and what to change.  Mort builders can do any of it.\n
The descs need to be appropriate to the color coded terrain map I\n
sent Syrah, and most importantly, the descs for the road between\n
Caemlyn and Aringill need to be changed from their current generic\n
desc to unique road descs.  All of this is written out much better\n
in the files I sent.\n
\n
Nenae and Beonca, you guys can continue your inns and newbie\n
zone - I'm very sorry about anything I lost.\n
\n
I should stress that this is a project that absolutely anybody can\n
handle - no real building is required anymore, since all the zones\n
are designed and linked.  All it needs is people, preferrably a\n
group of them, to go in and write better descs for each of the\n
existing rooms around the cities.  We're not going to do this for\n
the entire continent - right now, we're on Caemlyn and Aringill,\n
and when I import the other major cities, we'll do them similarly.\n
Any questions, feel free to beep me.  Thank Boris and Duren\n
for a hell of a job - our world isn't just bigger than other circle muds\n
now, it's a whole version ahead of them codewise. :p\n
\n
-Nico\n

bring Tyme back to life!    \n

Overhaul.  Spoiler Alert: `&This means that we are starting \n
from scratch at the end of Winter's Heart`6.  From there, A Moment \n
in Tyme will be a mirror world, where we write our own story.  Character \n
backgrounds will need to be re-written to exclude much of what has gone \n
before in the game, though original character concepts and backgrounds \n
can be worked into the new timeline.  `!Weaponmastery and Channeling \n
Mastery are a thing of the past.`6  The Imms are currently in the process \n
of reviewing the policies of the game.  Player input is welcome and \n
encouraged.  We have new guild leaders for Band of the Red Hand, the \n
Black Tower, Wolfkin, Children of the Light and Council.  There are still \n
guild leader spots to be filled.\n

We will have a new turn-based combat system, auto-quests for quest\n
points, and a large Ubermap to explore, with all kinds of secrets\n
to uncover.  Tyme is currently an evolving work in progress, and RP\n
is going to be our major means of earning experience and levels until\n
the combat code is in. Volunteers to help are appreciated!\n

IC updates and rumors are posted under "`6updates`7".\n
Visit our webpage at `6http://www.tymemud.com`7\n
Type "`2help newbie`7" for an essential index to help.\n
Type "`2timeline`7" for an overview of recent events.\n
Type "`2recall`7" at any time to return to Caemlyn.\n
Type "`2help cairhien`7" or "`2help caemlyn`7" for directions.\n
Vote for us at: \n
`2http://www.tymemud.com`7\n

passed away on September 16, 2007.  Without him, Tyme would not exist, and\n
we thank him for all of the memories that he has given us over the years.\n

Sanderson`3 for completing the books for the fans of a much beloved series.`7\n
